data.title: Call Me Mother (Season 1)
authors: Contributors to RuPaul's Drag Race Wiki
data.meta_description: The first season of Call Me Mother is a Canadian reality television series, premiering on OutTV in 2021. data.text:
Call Me Mother 1 2

The first season of Call Me Mother is a Canadian reality television series, premiering on OutTV in 2021. Hosted by Entertainment Tonight Canada reporter Dallas Dixon, the series is a drag competition which will see up-and-coming drag performers compete in group challenges, with one queen eliminated each week until the winner of the competition is crowned the "First Child of Drag"[1].

The series is distinct from the RuPaul's Drag Race franchise in adding a drag mother mentoring and coaching team aspect reminiscent of The Voice, and is also fully inclusive, featuring drag queens, drag kings and transgender or non-binary performers. The drag artists will aim to get into one of three houses – Peppermint’s House of Dulcet, Crystal’s House of Glass and Barbada de Barbades’s House of Harmonie – along with the opportunity to be mentored and coached by a renowned drag performer. The houses will compete weekly as a family in a series of challenges, with the drag mother of the losing house eliminating one of her own[2].

The series is produced by Go Button Media and RedFlame TV[3].

In 2023, Kiki Coe appeared on Season 4 of Canada's Drag Race, where she placed 6th.

Series # Episode # Episode Title Airdate 1 1 Episode 1 October 25, 2021 2 2 Episode 2 November 1, 2021 3 3 Episode 3 November 8, 2021 4 4 Episode 4 November 15, 2021 5 5 Episode 5 November 22, 2021 6 6 Episode 6 November 29, 2021 7 7 Episode 7 December 6, 2021 8 8 Episode 8 December 13, 2021

Episode 1[]

Airdate: October 25, 2021

Adoption Challenge: Participate in three adoption rounds until 9 queens are adopted by the mothers.

Round 1: Look- The drag artists showcase their best drag.

Adopted in Round 1: Kiki Coe, Rosie

Round 2: Talent- All unadopted drag artists showcase a talent for the mothers

Adopted in Round 2: Valerie Hunt, Felicia Bonée, HercuSleaze, Sanjina Dabish Queen, Toddy

Round 3: Tea: Remaining 3 drag artists spill the tea with the mothers.

Adopted in Round 3: Narcissa Wolfe, Calypso Cosmic

House of Dulcet: Felicia Bonée, Kiki Coe and Toddy

House of Harmonie: Narcissa Wolfe, Calypso Cosmic and Sanjina Dabish Queen

House of Glass: HercuSleaze, Valerie Hunt and Rosie

Eliminated: Ella Lamoureux

Episode 2[]

Airdate: November 1, 2021

Mini Challenge: Create a cake that looks like your House Mother

Mini Challenge Winner: Valerie Hunt

Runway Category: My Drag Journey: A look giving insight into the start of their drag

Highest Score: House of Dulcet

Prize: Headstart to prepare for the Showcase

Showcase: Let Them Eat Cake: Design a Marie Antoinette inspired look

Highest Score: House of Dulcet

Bottom House: House of Glass

Eliminated: Rosie

Trivia[]

Season 1 of Call Me Mother is the first of any drag competition...

... to have drag queens as mentors rather than hosts, Peppermint, Crystal and Barbada de Barbades.

... to have no challenge winners.

However, this would be supplemented with highest scoring team, which would become highest scoring drag artist(s) on Episode 6.

Season 1 of Call Me Mother is the second of any drag competition...

... to have contestants compete weekly as a team, after All Stars 1.
